alert.note: Alert for Clark; Coles; Cumberland; Edgar; Effingham; Moultrie; Shelby (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 5:53PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Coles, southwestern Edgar, southeastern Moultrie, northwestern Clark, southeastern Shelby, western Cumberland and northern Effingham Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 553 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Humboldt to near Neoga to near Beecher City. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Charleston and Lerna around 610 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Janesville, Toledo and Ashmore. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 between mile markers 159 and 196. Interstate 70 between mile markers 92 and 99. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for south central, central and east central Illinois.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Coles; Cumberland; Edgar; Effingham; Moultrie; Shelby
